description: In this study, we show for the first time that the tick Haemaphysalis longicornis secretes EVs in saliva that resembles exosomes. EVs were purified from pilocarpine induced saliva of partially engorged H. longicornis ticks. Electron microscopy analysis revealed the presence of exosome-like vesicles with a size of 100 nm. Proteomic analysis by LC-MS/MS identified a total of 356 proteins in tick-derived EVs.

keywords.name: submitter keyword
keywords.value: Exosomes;Extracellular vesicles; Saliva; Proteomics; Haemaphysalis longicornis

terms.name: Reference
terms.value: Nawaz M, Malik MI, Zhang H, Hassan IA, Cao J, Zhou Y, Hameed M, Hussain Kuthu Z, Zhou J. Proteomic Analysis of Exosome-Like Vesicles Isolated From Saliva of the Tick Haemaphysalis longicornis. Front Cell Infect Microbiol. 2020 Oct 22;10:542319. doi: 10.3389/fcimb.2020.542319. PMID: 33194791; PMCID: PMC7642894.

title: Proteomic analysis of exosome like vesicles isolated from saliva of the tick Haemaphysalis longicornis
